message_1: Suppose P and Q are propositional variables such that P is true and Q is false. Find the truth value of the statement: P or Q.
message_2: In propositional logic, the "or" operator (also known as the disjunction operator) is true if at least one of the propositions is true. In this case, P is true and Q is false. Since at least one of the propositions (P) is true, the statement "P or Q" is true.
